newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU jobs summit set for Nov 21-22 - Belgian minister.
newsitem.headline: EU jobs summit set for Nov 21-22 - Belgian minister.

text.p: European labour ministers have agreed that a European Union summit on the fight against unemployment should be held on November 21-22 in Luxembourg, Belgian Labour Minister Miet Smet said.
It was the first time exact dates had been given for the jobs summit, which was originally announced following a meeting of EU leaders in Amsterdam in June.

Smet told the Belgian daily newspaper De Standaard in an interview published on Tuesday that the summit, the first to be held specifically on the subject, should aim to agree on measures which would halve unemployment in the 15-nation bloc.
EU leaders should set ambitious targets. "In a Europe with more than 18 million unemployed there is no alternative," she said.
Measures should include cheap loans from the European Investment Bank to companies and more effective use of structural funds for aid to impoverished regions.
Cash should be pumped into large infrastructure projects, such as high-speed train links and telecommunications networks, she said.
France proposed last Thursday that European trade unions and employers be represented at the summit.
Paris wants to discuss the idea of a reduction in working hours to create jobs.
Other countries are likely to call for greater labour market flexibility, to which France is hostile.
